definition: to seize/to confiscate
see 山查[shan1 zha1]
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: The police have the right to confiscate any forbidden objects they find.
sentences.chinese: 如發現違禁貨物，警方有權查扣。

to detain/to hold in custody/to distrain/to seize property

(of a perpetrator, victim, weapon, sum of money etc) to be involved in the case
lair/den (of illegal activities)
to arrest
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
to manufacture and sell
a suspect
sudden unannounced investigation/on-the-spot inspection/to search without notification
inspector
to be a suspect (in a crime)/to be suspected of
